messages.subject: Re: What do you still want to do/learn?
messages.msgSnippet: innovating/improving my website navigate by weather/meteorology walk/travel around the world self-reliantly/sufficiently, independently wilderness/survival
messages.messageBody:
innovating/improving my website
navigate by weather/meteorology
walk/travel around the world self-reliantly/sufficiently,
independently
wilderness/survival skills
multiple outdoor sports
perhaps an extreme sport or more
being a better person in every way everyday; be mE; be blissFUL; be
free
martial arts - leaning toward internal styles and gong fu
read all books I enjoy to read
enjoy/create fine/performing arts, shows/events
cinemaphotography for IMAX,some special shows on TLC, Nat'l Geo,
Dis, Dis Kids
alternative medicine/healing methods
spirituality, beliefs, religion, philosophy, metaphysics,
alternative science
unschooling OR words that work best akin to the definition
meditation, yoga
exercise for fun
learn as much as I desire

there's more probably.....

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] RE: 2006 Conference (was What do you still want to do/learn?)
messages.msgSnippet: We will likely be in the South Cali area -- maybe even San Diego -- for a big family reunion in 2006, sadly it s likely to be in July or August to accommodate
messages.messageBody:
We will likely be in the South Cali area -- maybe even San Diego -- for a big family reunion in 2006, sadly it's likely to be in July or August to accommodate school vacation. That will be free to us, tho, so maybe we could swing another trip in October -- at least then we'd know the area.

Syl

messages.subject: Re: What do you still want to do/learn?
messages.msgSnippet: ... I would like to BE a lactation consultant, but have run scared away from the idea of becoming one. Thousands of hours of experience, classes, thick
messages.messageBody:
--- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, "Danielle Conger"
<danielle.conger@c...> wrote:
> Things I still want to learn:
> lactation consultant or doula

I would like to BE a lactation consultant, but have run scared away
from the idea of becoming one. Thousands of hours of experience,
classes, thick textbooks, etc. Or is there a different path that
doesn't make me start having school nightmares again?? I just want to
know stuff and help people, darn it!

--aj

messages.subject: Re: What do you still want to do/learn?
messages.msgSnippet: Some exerpts from my Life List (I keep it as a Word doc on my computer). The first five items I m actively working on accomplishing in the next couple of years
messages.messageBody:
Some exerpts from my Life List (I keep it as a Word doc on my
computer). The first five items I'm actively working on accomplishing
in the next couple of years and I have sub-goals for all of those.
The rest are in the 5+ year plan, which means I haven't really
started planning specifics for them yet.

- Be able to play the Celtic fiddle music that I love to listen to
- Publish my novel(s)
- Run all of our vehicles on non-gasoline fuels
- Complete a marathon and an Ironman-distance triathlon
- See Australia
- Climb Denali, Mt. Rainier, Mt. Hood, Aconcagua
- Get my instrument rating on my pilot's license
- Return to Tanzania as a volunteer for some length of time
- Learn Swahili
- Build a strawbale house
- Scuba dive in the Seychellese, Maldives, Costa Rica, Roatan
(endless list, really)
- Bicycle across the U.S.
- Exhibit my photography

Blue Skies,
-Robin-

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] What do you still want to do/learn?
messages.msgSnippet: host an  unschoolers confrence Let me know exactly how serious you are about this! ~Kelly, retired  conference
messages.messageBody:
host an unschoolers confrence<<<<<<

And yet ANOTHER guinea pig?

Coooooool! <G>

Let me know exactly how serious you are about this!

~Kelly, retired conference coordinator

****

Kelly, if the Live & Learn folks would bring their conference anywhere reachable from Albuquerque (or actually here) I'd help all I could with that. I'd love to go to the conference this year, but I'm just willing to travel to Boston in August (or any other time, for that matter). We may be in DC next July (LaLeche Intl conference) but it probably won't mesh with any other conferences.

Syl

messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/9/04 8:36:59 AM, panda@xionic.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/9/04 8:36:59 AM, panda@... writes:

<< I love unschooling with my kids, because
I get to unschool too!
>>

The virtuous modelling of natural learning! <bwg>

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] What do you still want to do/learn?
messages.msgSnippet: ... I sit and think about all the things I ve learned and then think about all the things I keep telling myself that I want to learn or do, and realize that
messages.messageBody:
> What a GREAT thread this is! Thank you Sandra for starting it.

I sit and think about all the things I've learned and then think about
all the things I keep telling myself that I want to learn or do, and
realize that I'm stuck in the old rut of NOT doing these things because
of this or that. I find that I get so busy cleaning the house,
cooking, taking care of the kids or husband, getting ready for the new
baby, unpacking from a recent move and whatever else comes along, that
I'm not doing anything fun! How boring I've become. Time to get out
and start doing things for me.

It's fun to see what everyone else wants to do with their life. I'll
have to think on mine for awhile. My husband has always felt that
since we have kids, we shouldn't be doing anything for ourselves
(especially me, since I'm the one who takes care of them). Well, that
is going to have to change. I love unschooling with my kids, because
I get to unschool too!

Faith
>

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] What do you still want to do/learn?
messages.msgSnippet: Things I have learned outside of school: sewing chess gourmet cooking rock climbing camping gardening landscape design backyard birds butterfly gardening water
messages.messageBody:
Things I have learned outside of school:
sewing
chess
gourmet cooking
rock climbing
camping
gardening
landscape design
backyard birds
butterfly gardening
water gardening
pond building
mothering
homeschooling
interior design
furniture refinishing
poultry keeping
heirloom poultry
treehouse building
shed building
hen house building
drywall installation
web design

Things I still want to learn:
homesteading
raising goats, sheep
horses
wool dying
lactation consultant or doula
homeschool/ family law
herbal medicine
where ever my heart takes me...I've learned to stop trying to predict it! ;)


--Danielle

http://www.danielleconger.com/Homeschool/Welcomehome.html

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] What do you still want to do/learn?
messages.msgSnippet: Kristen writes: I want to convert my home into a completely independent homestead with utilities only as backup! ... Ha! I just started reading about
messages.messageBody:
Kristen writes:

I want to convert my home into a completely independent homestead with utilities only as backup!
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>.

Ha! I just started reading about earthships, 'off the grid' houses built from tires and earth. But I think I'll go for an earth bermed concrete block home (my FIL is a bricklayer and my DH is pratically a journeyman, cheap labour!). The power limitations in a self contained earthship are too much for a family that loves it's computer, TV, dvd, vcr, etc. :)I'm reading all I can and already thinking that when it comes time to get an architect to customize house plans, maybe I could barter something for his help. This is what unschooling has done to me. It lets me see all the different paths to a goal instead of limiting me to 1 or 2 that I have to nix.
If you see any neat related webites in your studies Kristen, let me know!

Dawn (in NS)


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] What do you still want to do/learn?
messages.msgSnippet: Some things I want to learn/do: be a lactation consultant to speak Spanish fluently (I learned in high school, but I ve forgotten most of it) to create a
messages.messageBody:
Some things I want to learn/do:

be a lactation consultant
to speak Spanish fluently (I learned in high school, but I've forgotten most of it)
to create a website
to write for publication
to be a better parent to my children
design/draft our own home someday
sew actual clothes -- not just mending and slings (first I need a machine, I guess)
grow herbs -- maybe for next year's garden

I'm sure more things will cross my path, and I'm more confident every day that I'll be able to learn them!

I left school, always an A student, with no desire to be taught anything else. I just wanted to be left alone and I was so tired of being told how smart I was, like that was some obligation to spend my life doing what they wanted me to do to make them proud. Maybe that explains the next 5 yrs spent in non-office jobs and a bad marriage! I was determined to be a non-achiever.

Thanks for the question, Sandra! It's been fun to explore how much of real life is learned away from a building and enforced structure.

Syl

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] What do you still want to do/learn?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, ... Amy Kagey Usborne Books in Ohio www.ubah.com/z0939 [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messages.messageBody:
Hi,
I'd still like to learn:
---to speak Italian
---to draw a lot better than I do
---to knit, even if it's only a scarf
---to make pottery
---to bake a great loaf of bread

Amy Kagey
Usborne Books in Ohio
www.ubah.com/z0939

messages.subject: What do you still want to do/learn?
messages.msgSnippet: Some things I want to learn/do: ~  to catch babies (midwifery) ~  to really play my guitar (more than the basics I know) ~  to play the recorder ~  to speak
messages.messageBody:
Some things I want to learn/do:

~ to catch babies (midwifery)
~ to really play my guitar (more than the basics I know)
~ to play the recorder
~ to speak Spanish
~ to create a website
~ to paint with water colors
~ to navigate by the stars
~ to write for publication
~ to spin yarn from wool
~ to dye yarn using natural pigments
~ much more about sailing
~ to be a better parent to my children

~Andrea
